iNumThreads: Number of threads to use with the game. Edit at your own risk. No proof this actually does anything
bDisablePlayerCollision: Probably some sort of No-Clip. Needs testing
bSimpleLighting: Enables simple lighting. Will probably increase performance and lower lighting quality. Needs Testing
fSunShadowUpdateTime: How long it takes shadows to move to their new position when the sun position updates. Lower = smoother transitions
fSunUpdateThreshold: How often the Sun position updates. Lower = Faster
bEnableVolumetricLighting: Enables volumetric lighting. Probably costs a lot of CPU if this command still works. Would look great in VR though. Needs Testing
fTAAPostSharpen: Increase/decrease the sharpening effect while using TAA
bDrawShadows: Enable or disables shadows. May increase performance. Probably looks bad
bCharacterLighting: Enable or disable character lighting. Probably looks more realistic with it turned off. Needs testing
bShadowsOnGrass: Toggles the ability of objects to cast shadows upon grass. The grass itself does not cast shadows. This may be disabled for a minor performance increase.
bTreesReceiveShadows: Toggles the ability of trees to cast shadows on themselves. It may be disabled for a slight performance gain.
bAllowShaderCache: Probably enables or disables the shader cache, if it works at all. Needs testing
bUseSunBeams: Possibly related to God rays? Needs testing
fDecalLifetime: How long Decals remain in a game
iVRWindowSize: Sets the size of the VR Window on your desktop. Not sure if this is a x or y value
bDoRadialBlur: Enables or disables depth of field
fVrScale: Scale of your player in VR. Higher makes you more of a giant (not just height but relative size). A lot of people set this to 75-76
bForceImmortal: Probably gives you God mode when enabled? Needs testing
bForceGodMode: Another god mode command? See: bForceImmortal. Not sure if there is a difference
fSneakEnterThreshold: The percentage of your height before considered sneaking. Lower = You have to crouch lower to activate. Setting to 0 probably makes it where you are never in sneak mode while crouching
fSneakExitThreshold: The percentage of your height before your player leaves sneak mode. Higher = You have to stand higher to exit sneaking
bAllowVRCheating: Lets you lean into objects without being kicked back. Feels more immersive when turned on
bDebugAlwaysShowWands: Setting to 1 always shows your controllers in game
bVRPauseOnControllerDisconnect: Turn this off to prevent the game from pausing when one of your controllers turns off
bPauseOnVROverlay: Disabling this will keep your game running while you open the vr overlay
fGunRotation: Changes the rotation of your gun, a common request for people to fine tune the angle they hold the gun at. Try 60-65
fSkyScaleFactor: Alters star field distance (users report 1000-2000 is a good distance)
bBorderRegionsEnabled: Turn this off to be able to walk past the map invisible borders. Use with caution
bDisableAllGore: Turn off gore, maybe good if you want kids to try this out or you don't like seeing blood
bAlwaysActive: Disable this (Set to 0) if you want the game to pause if another window is in front
uGridsToLoad: Don't mess with this. It causes issues. It determines how many cells around your player to load. Will corrupt your save if you edit this midgame
iNumHWThreads: How many threads the game uses. No real proof that editing this value does anything at all
fComfortModeVignetteHardness: Change this value to make the vignette fade in more or less (lower = gradual fade to black)
bFadeWorldWhenMenuIsOpen: Fade the game world when you open a menu, or leave it clear. Needs to be tested
fMapVrDirectMovementSpeed: Probably how fast you can direct move in VR? Value is pretty height, might not even do anything. Needs testing
fLockScale: Scale of the lock while lock picking. Make the value bigger to make the lock bigger
fLockPositionZ: Z location of the lock while picking
fLockPositionY: Y location of the lock while picking
fLockPositionX: X Position of the lock while picking
fHUDCompassScale: Size of the compass. Heigher number = bigger compass
sHUDCompassModel: Perhaps you can edit this with a custom compass model when a mod is released
fNoteScale: Probably changes the size of notes when being read. If this works it could make it easier to read in VR. Needs testing
fBookScale: Probably changes the size of books when being read. If this works it could make it easier to read in VR. Needs testing
bPlayVRMeleeWorldImpactSounds: Probably enabling this lets you hear the sound of melee impacts when you hit world objects
bUseBulletWaterDisplacements: Probably shows bullets splashing in water. If turning this off works it could potentially increase performance. Needs testing
bForceHighDetailReflections: In Fallout 3, this forced more objects to be reflected in the water. Doesn't appear to be used by this game
bForceLowDetailReflections: In Fallout 3, this forced less objects to be reflected in the water. Doesn't appear to be used by this game
bUseWater: Stops water from rendering. Water still is there and you can swim in it
bShowTutorials: Enable or Disable Tutorials. 1 = Enabled 0 = Disabled
bShowCrosshair: Show or hide the crosshair. Not sure if this effects VR or not
bUseWandDirectionalMovement: Turning this off makes you no longer steer your character using your hands
iConsoleTextSize: Text size of the developer console
rConsoleTextColor: RGB Value to change the color of the developer console text
iConsoleSizeScreenPercent: How much of the screen the developer console takes up (Percentage)
bEnableAudio: Set to 0 to disable audio. Probably not useful for anyone.
bForceNPCsUseAmmo: This will force the NPC to use ammo on all guns. 1 = Forced 0 = Disabled
bForceFullDetail: Force full details of trees. May make the game look prettier at the cost of performance
bEnableTrees: Toggles the "dynamic" rendering of trees. If disabled, all trees will be skinned and inanimate, using the "static" version of tree rendering, which also removes tree popping.
bFogEnabled: Enable or Disable the Fog weather Effect. 1 = Enabled 0 = Disabled. Could potentially increase performance if disabled
bPrecipitation: Enable or Disable Rain Weather Effect. 1 = Enabled 0 = Disabled
bBloodSplatterEnabled: Enables or disables blood splatter on the screen. Might not do anything in VR. Needs testing
uDecalCount: Total number of decals allowed at once. Could effect performance
uLightCount: Number of real lights allowed at once. Could effect performance
iShadowMapResolution: Shadow resolution. Edit in proper intervals (256, 512, 1024, etc)
bUseTAA: Use TAA post processing. Disabling may increase aliasing but makes the game less fuzzy looking
bGamepadEnabled: disable this to disable the use of a gamepad for this game
fHUDOpacity: Transparency of the HUD. 1 = Fully Opaque. 0 = Fully Transparent (Invisible)
bSaveOnPause: Enable to autosave when the game is paused
bSaveOnTravel: Enable to autosave when you fast travel
bSaveOnWait: Enable to autosave when you wait
bSaveOnRest: Enable to autosave when you sleep
bShowCompass: Show or Hide the Compass from your UI. 1 = Shown 0 = Hidden
bLeftHandedMode: Set to 1 to make your character left handed
bDirectMovementWithWands: Set to 1 to use direct movement instead of teleport
bShowQuestMarkers: Show or hide quest markers. Needs testing
iDifficulty: Difficulty of the game. 0 = Easiest -> 5 = Hardest
bComfortSwim: Enables or disables comfort swimming (motion sickness prevention)
bOneTimeCalibrationCompleted: Set to 0 if you want to go through the calibration/tutorial again before starting the game
bComfortSneak: Enables or disables the comfort vignette while sneaking
bRealisticShield: Not sure what this does to shields, but probably like the bow, probably gives you more control over the shield
bAlwaysRunByDefault: Set to 1 to always run when pressing forward. Needs testing in VR
bGamePadRumble: Enable or disables the rumblepad in your controllers
bUseRealisticBowAiming: Set to 1 to let you control your bow and arrow more. A lot better than the default bow handling
bComfortModeWhileMoving: Enables or disables the comfort vignette when moving around
bComfortModeWhileTurning: Enables or disables the comfort vignette when turning
bDecals: Enables or disables decals. Turning off could increase performance
uMaxSkinDecals: How many decals on character skins. Lower could increase performance
uMaxDecals: Global number of decals that can render at once. Lower could increase performance
fHUDMenuX: Moves the compass and healthbars across the X axis
fHUDMenuY: Moves the compass and healthbars across the Y axis
fHUDMenuZ: Moves the compass and healthbars across the Z axis
bHealthBarShowing: Show the Enemy Health Bar. 1 = Enabled 0 = Disabled. Doesn't have any effect in VR so far. Needs more testing
fSunBaseSize: Sets the sun's base size. Setting it to 0 will remove the sun altogether, albeit the day will still be lit.
iCompassPosition: Decides where the compass is located, you can toggle this in the in-game VR Settings. 1 = Above your view, 0 = Below your view
fMaxTime: Physics refresh rate. Recommended to change to 0.0111. Recommended to change fMaxTimeComplex relative to this value.
fMaxTimeComplex: Complex Physics refresh rate. Recommended to set this to double the value of fMaxTime
bDoDepthOfField: Setting to 0 disables UNDERWATER FOG (NOT Depth of field unfortunately)
fMeleeSwingAngularVelocityThreshold: Sets the sensitivity of a registered swing of a weapon using motion controllers. This is for the primary hand. See 'fShieldLinearVelocityThreshold' for non-primary
fShieldLinearVelocityThreshold: Recommend setting to 2-4.5. Sets the sensitivity of a registered swing/block of a shield/weapon using motion controllers. This is for your non-primary hand. See 'fMeleeSwingAngularVelocityThreshold' for primary
fMeleeLinearVelocityThreshold: Recommend setting to 4-6. Sets the sensitivity of a registered melee punch
bFull Screen: Set this to 1 to make your desktop window full screen. This may increase performance due to how Windows treats fullscreen games vs windowed/borderless
uMaxNumPhysicsStepsPerUpdate: Set this to 1 to get rid of hiccuping objects
iShadowUpdateFrameDelay: Set this to 1 to make the shadows stop flickering on 3d movable objects after you edit fMaxTime
fNearDistance: How close an object needs to be to your view before it dissapears. Setting to a low value like 13 may help with mountains flickering
fMagicRotationPitch: Sets the angle from your hands that magic projects from. Set to 40-60 depending on where you want it (higher = higher in the hand)
fMagicHandRotate: Rotates the hand model when you are casting magic
fLeftHandShieldRotationRoll: Set to -10 to make it easier to move and block with your shield at the same time
fRightHandShieldRotationRoll: Set to 10 to make it easier to move and block with your shield at the same time
fActivatePickLength: How close you have to be to an object to grab it. 20 is more immersive
fAutoAimScreenPercentageVROverride: Set to 0 to turn off the Bow auto aim. Also see 'fAutoAimScreenPercentageVR'
fAutoAimScreenPercentageVR: Set to 0 to turn off the Bow auto aim. Also see 'fAutoAimScreenPercentageVROverride'
bImmediatelyGrabObjectOnActivate: Set this to 0 to remove the pull to character effect when you pick up items.
fDualCastMinDistance: How far apart your hands must be to dual cast magic. Recommend to set to 20 for a more immersive experience
fMinPulsesForFullSwipe: changes how many menu items are selected for one swipe across the track pad (minimum)
fMaxPulsesForFullSwipe: changes how many menu items are selected for one swipe across the track pad (maximum)
fAlternateTriggerThreshold: If you prefer a hair trigger that you cant keep mashing while its still depressed, set to 0.001
bUseAlternateTriggerThreshold: Set to 0 to bypass the alternate trigger threshold (search: fAlternateTriggerThreshold)
fDownwardGrabFloorDistanceMultiplier: Setting this to 0 stops the wands from extending out when the controller is pointed down
fSecondaryWandMaxGrabDistance: this is ignored by fDownwardGrabFloorDistanceMultiplier when aiming at the floor
fPrimaryWandMaxGrabDistance: this is ignored by fDownwardGrabFloorDistanceMultiplier when aiming at the floor
bDisableCompositor: This stops the game from rendering in the headset. You'll just see the steamVR loading screen. Pretty useless for us
fVrPowerArmorScaleMultiplier: Scale of your player inside Power Armor. This is a multiplier to fVrScale so only change this if you want to be a lot bigger in Power Armor but not out
bVrShowIntroBink: Disables the VR intro Video when starting the game
bAutoLoadLastSaveGame: Setting to 1 will just load the last save game instead of asking you to pick a save
fComfortVignetteSizeMax: This effects the maximum value for the Vignette when using the in-game slider
fComfortVignetteSizeMin: This effects the minimum value for the Vignette when using the in-game slider
bInfiniteAmmo: Probably for giving infinite ammo, but I wasn't able to get it to work when set to 1
fVrRunSpeedScalar: Increasing this will increase how fast your character will sprint. May cause vomiting if used incorrectly
fVrStrafeSpeedScalar: Increasing this will increase how fast your character will straf. May cause vomiting if used incorrectly
bDisableAllSaves: Disables game saving when set to 1
fWorkbenchScale: Sets distance AND scale of the floating crafting menu. Don't set it too high as the menu gets hidden by walls/furniture.
fPrimaryWandHUDZ: Moves the HUD (ie ammo in your gun) on your primary wand hand on the Z axis in the world (Height Up and down)
fPrimaryWandHUDY: Moves the HUD (ie ammo in your gun) on your primary wand hand on the Y axis in the world (depth back/forward)
fPrimaryWandHUDX: Moves the HUD (ie ammo in your gun) on your primary wand hand on the X axis in the world (left to right)
fHUDLootZ: Changes the location of the Quick Loot HUD on the Z plane in the world (up/down height from your wand)
fHUDLootY: Changes the location of the Quick Loot HUD on the Y plane in the world (depth from your wand)
fHUDLootX: Changes the location of the Quick Loot HUD on the X plane in the world (left to right of your wand)
fFavoritesTouchpadCenterButtonPercent: Sets the proportion (not percent) of the trackpad where a press is considered a center-button press and not a directional press up down left or right.
bInvalidateOlderFiles: Set this to 1 to allow the loading of loose files in the data\ folder
sResourceDataDirsFinal: This can be used to support loading loose folders in the Data directory. This method has been superceeded with bInvalidateOlderFiles
bFootstepSoundsEnabled: Enables or Disables Footstep sounds. 1 = Enabled 0 = Disabled
fDefaultMasterVolume: Master Volume Level. Can be 'boosted' by setting higher than 1
bApplyCameraNodeAnimations: You need to set this to 0 if you are trying to mess with the default camera location for third person.
f1st3rdSwitchDelay: How long of a delay between switching from 1st to 3rd person. Lower is faster.
f3rdPersonAimFOV: The ADS field of view when in Third person.
fMouseWheelZoomIncrement: How much further/closer you move to your player while using the scrollwheel in third person. Lower = Smoother transitions
fMouseWheelZoomSpeed: How fast zooming occurs when scrolling the mouse to change your distance to your player in third person
fOverShoulderCombatAddY: Moves the Y axis of the third person Camera while in combat
fOverShoulderCombatPosX: Moves the X axis of the third person Camera while in combat
fOverShoulderCombatPosZ: Moves the Z axis of the third person Camera while in combat
fOverShoulderMeleeCombatPosX: Moves the X axis of the camera while in melee
fOverShoulderMeleeCombatPosZ: Moves the Z axis of the camera while in melee
fOverShoulderPosX: Moves the X axis of the third person Camera while not in combat
fOverShoulderPosZ: Moves the Z axis of the third person Camera while not in combat
fVanityModeMaxDist: The furthest distance you can zoom out in in vanity mode.
fVanityModeMinDist: The closest vanity mode can get to your model
bIronSightsZoomEnable: Enables or Disables Iron sights zooming. 1 = Enabled 0 = Disabled. This hasn't been tested
fAimDownDegrees: How many degrees Vertically can you aim. 90 = Directly down.
fAimUpDegrees: How many degrees Vertically can you aim. 90 = Directly above.
bBackgroundMouse: Enable this to show the windows Cursor while playing. 1 = Enabled 0 = Disabled
fEnterWorkshopDelay: How long you have to hold the workshop key to Enter workshop mode
fIronSightsPitchSpeedRatio: This alters the speed of your mouse while in Iron sights. Set to 1 to disable speed difference.
fMouseHeadingXScale: Mouse X Axis sensitivity multiplier. Higher makes the mouse move faster Left to Right
fMouseHeadingYScale: Mouse Y Axis sensitivity multiplier. Higher makes the mouse move faster Up to Down
fPipboyLightDelay: Sets how long you have to hold the pipboy key to turn on your flashlight
fPitchSpeedRatio: This is the multiplier that controls Up and down (Y axis) mouse movement. Setting this to 1 will make the sensitivity ratio equal to your X axis
fPowerArmorExitDelay: How long you must hold the Exit power armor key to trigger
fThrowDelay: How long you have to hold the bash key to pull the pin of a grenade
fZKeyDelay: Sets how long you have to hold the use key to pick up an object
uMaxSkinDecalPerActor: Set this higher for more decals, could effect performance
bShowMarkers: This will Show or Hide Markers. 1 = Show 0 = Hide
fDecalLOD0: How far away from the player decals show
fDefault1stPersonFOV: The Field of view for the Firstperson camera
fDefaultFOV: This edits the first person FOV. Don't mess with this in VR
fDefaultWorldFOV: The Field of view for the third person camera. Set to 80-100 for a better PC experience
fPipboyScreenDiffuseIntensity: Changes the Brightness of the Pipboy Text/Images
fPipboyScreenDiffuseIntensityPA: Changes the Brightness of the Pipboy Text/Images while in Power Armor
fPipboyScreenEmitIntensity: Changes the Brightness of the Pipboy Text/Images
fPipboyScreenEmitIntensityPA: Changes the Brightness of the Pipboy Text/Images while in Power Armor
iLocation X: X location for your Game window to appear at. 0 sets it on the default monitor.
iLocation Y: Y location for your Game window to appear at. 0 sets it on the default monitor.
uiPipboyLightR: Red color channel for Pipboy Light 0->255
uiPipboyLightG: Green color channel for Pipboy Light 0->255
uiPipboyLightB: Blue color channel for Pipboy Light 0->255
uiPowerArmorR: Red color channel for Power Armor UI (Dont think it works though) 0->255
uiPowerArmorG: Green color channel for Power Armor UI (Dont think it works though) 0->255
uiPowerArmorB: Blue color channel for Power Armor UI (Dont think it works though) 0->255
uiPowerArmorLightR: Red color channel for Power Armor Light 0->255
uiPowerArmorLightG: Green color channel for Power Armor Light 0->255
uiPowerArmorLightB: Blue color channel for Power Armor Light 0->255
bEssentialTakeNoDamage: This lets you kill Essential NPCs. Setting this to 0 can break the game if main quest characters Die!
fPlayerHealthSaveOnPauseLimit: How much health you must have for the game to perform an autosave. 1 = Full health 0 = no health.
iTerminalLockoutTime: How long you are locked out of a terminal if you fail to hack it. (In Seconds)
bEnableMainMenuBink: This Enables or Disables the video on the Main menu. Disabling may make your main menu load faster on slower systems.
bForceUpdateDiffuseOnly: You must set this to 0 If you mess with the Degrade and Upgrade Texture Distance settings
bPauseOnAltTab: Set this to 0 to keep the game from pausing when you alt tab
bPlayMainMenuMusic: Set this to 0 to turn off the main menu music
bUseHardDriveCache: Set this to 1 if you don't have enough RAM to keep the game loaded. Could help with performance on weak systems.
fEncumberedReminderTimer: How often the game reminds you that you are carrying too much. Lower = More reminders
iTextureDegradeDistance0: The First Tier distance from your player that texture quality degrades (Helps with performance)
iTextureDegradeDistance1: The Second Tier distance from your player that texture quality degrades (Helps with performance)
iTextureUpgradeDistance0: The first Tier distance from your player that texture quality Increases
iTextureUpgradeDistance1: The Second Tier distance from your player that texture quality increases
sIntroMovie: Use this to specify an Intro Movie File
sIntroSequence: Sequence of Intro Videos to play. Set this the value 'none' to disable.
sMainMenuMusic: This selects the music file to play on the main menu
sStartingConsoleCommand: Console Command to execute When the game starts
uExterior Cell Buffer: Outside Cell buffer size. Game doesn't read any value lower than 47 for some reason. Increase this if yo u increase your uGridsToLoad.
uMainMenuDelayBeforeAllowSkip: Delay at the main menu before input lets you skip the video. Set to 1 to make it instant. 0 does not work.
iMinGrassSize: Lower Equals higher Grass Density. May decrease performance. Put higher to lower Grass Density
fBookOpenTime: How long it takes to open a book in milliseconds. Lower numbers open books faster. The default value opens the book in 1 second
fCrosshairAlphaPercent: The transparency of the Crosshair. 0% is completely transparent. 100% is completely opaque.
fMaxSubtitleDistance: How far you can get from an NPC before the subtitles dissapear
fSafeZoneX: Margin from the edge of the screen (x axis on 4:3) your UI is placed. Lower = Closer
fSafeZoneXWide: Margin from the edge of the screen (x axis on 16:9) your UI is placed. Lower = Closer
fSafeZoneXWide16x10: Margin from the edge of the screen (x axis on 16:10) your UI is placed. Lower = Closer
fSafeZoneY: Margin from the edge of the screen (y axis on 4:3) your UI is placed. Lower = Closer
fSafeZoneYWide: Margin from the edge of the screen (y axis on 16:9) your UI is placed. Lower = Closer
fSafeZoneYWide16x10: Margin from the edge of the screen (y axis on 16:10) your UI is placed. Lower = Closer
uConfirmContainerTakeAllMinimumItems: How many of the same items must be in a container before it asks you to confirm if you want them all
uSubtitleB: Blue Color Channel for Subtitle text. 0-255
uSubtitleG: Green Color Channel for Subtitle text. 0-255
uSubtitleR: Red Color Channel for Subtitle text. 0-255
iPipboyColorB: Blue Channel color of the Pipboy. 0-255
iPipboyColorG: Green Channel color of the Pipboy. 0-255
iPipboyColorR: Red Channel color of the Pipboy. 0-255
bAllowYesToAll: Lets you select Yes for All if prompted by multiple prompts. 1 = Enabled 0 = Disabled
bBlockMessageBoxes: Blocks or Allows Message Boxes. 1 = Blocked 0 = Allow
bUseCompanionWarping: Set this to 0 to stop Companions from Warping to you when they are too far away. 1 = Enable Warping 0 = Disable
bPipboyDisableFX: Disables all Pipboy Effects. Useful if a mod reskins the pipboy UI. 1 = Disabled FX 0 = Enabled FX
bPipboyEffectColorOnLight: Set this to 0 to not use the pipboy screen color as your flashlight color.
fVATSRangedLongDistance: How far away an enemy can be for VATS to work. Higher = Further distances
bReflectSky: Reflect the sky in the water. 1 = Enabled 0 = Disabled
bUseWaterHiRes: Use High Resolution water. 1 = Enabled 0 = Disabled
fSunGlareSize: Changes the size of the glare of the sun. Higher = Bigger
bInfiniteItems: Possibly will give you infinite Items in workshop mode? Untested. 1 = Enabled
bWorkshopAutoSaveOnExit: Should the game auto save when you exist Work Shop Mode? 1 = Enabled 0 = Disabled
bWorkshopEnableGridBasedSnapping: Enable Grid snapping for workshop items. 1 = Enabled 0 = Disabled
fItemHoldDistantSpeed: How far away an item can be for you to be able to hold it (Higher = Further)
fItemRotationSpeed: How fast you can rotate an item (higher = faster)
bInvertYValues: Invert the Gamepad Y Axis. 1 = Enabled 0 = Disabled
bAllowShadowcasterNPCLights: Enable this to allow NPC lights to cast shadows. ( Will lower performance) 1 = Enabled 0 = Disabled
bEnableWetnessMaterials: Enables or disables wetness materials. 1 = Enabled 0 = Disabled
bForceIgnoreSmoothness: This is a texture setting, not mouse acceleration. Not sure if it really changes much
bMaximizeWindow: Stretches the window to fit your resolution. (May cause the game to be cut off) 1 = Enabled 0 = Disabled
bSAOEnable: Enables or Disables Ambient Occlusion. 1 = Enabled 0 = Disabled
bTopMostWindow: Sets the game to always be on top of all windows. This will prevent you from being able to alt tab on single monitors.
bVolumetricLightingEnable: Enable or disbale the Volumetric Lighting (May increase performance) 1 = Enabled 0 = Disabled
fBlendSplitDirShadow: This is the radius of how far shadows will start to decrease in quality (LOD) Lower will decrease performance
fDirShadowDistance: How far to render shadows. Lower = Better performance
fShadowDistance: How far away shadows should render. Higher will decrease performance
iMaxAnisotropy: Sets Anistropic Filtering. 0 2 4 8 16 are the values you should use
iMaxDecalsPerFrame: Total number of decals to render every frame
iPresentInterval: This enables or disables Vsync in game. 0 = off 1=on. Some Report 2 works as well.
sAntiAliasing: Set the AA to use for the game. FXAA or TAA
bShowFloatingQuestMarkers: Shows or hides Floating quest markers on the compass. 1 = Enabled 0 = Disabled
bPipboyCompanionEnabled: Enables or disables the Pipboycompanion App. 1 = Enable 0 = Disable
fGrassStartFadeDistance: This determines how far away from your character you can see grass.
bLensFlare: Enable or Disable Lens Flare effect. 1 = Enabled 0 = Disabled
bMBEnable: Enable or Disable Motion Blur Effect. 1 = Enabled 0 = Disabled
bScreenSpaceBokeh: Enable or Disable Bokeh (High quality motion Blur) 1 = Enabled 0 = Disabled
bDialogueCameraEnable: Enable or disable the use of the dialogue camera. 1 = Enabled 0 = Disabled
bDialogueSubtitles: Enable or Disable Dialogue Subtitles. 1 = Enabled 0 = Disabled
bGeneralSubtitles: Enable or Disable General Subtitles. 1 = Enabled 0 = Disabled
iHUDColorR: Red Color Channel for the Heads up Display
iHUDColorG: Green Color Channel for the Heads up Display
iHUDColorB: Blue Color Channel for the Heads up Display
bEnableFileSelection: Set this to 1 to enable plugin support in the launcher (may no longer work) 1 = Enable 2 = Disable
bScreenSpaceReflections: Enable or disable Screenspace Reflections. 1 = Enabled 0 = Disabled
bScreenSpaceSubsurfaceScattering: Enable or Disable Screenspace Subsurface Scattering. 1 = Enabled 0 = Disabled
fLODFadeOutMultActors: Fadeout value for Actors. Higher = Further distance
fLODFadeOutMultItems: Fadeout value for Items. Higher = Further distance
fLODFadeOutMultObjects: Fadeout value for Objects. Higher = Further distance
fLODFadeOutMultSkyCell: Fadeout value for Sky cells. Higher = Further distance
bCrosshairEnabled: Enable or disable the crosshair. 1 = Enabled 0 = Disabled
fModMenuEffectColorR: Red Color Channel for the Weapon/Armor Modding UI
fModMenuEffectColorG: Green Color Channel for the Weapon/Armor Modding UI
fModMenuEffectColorB: Blue Color Channel for the Weapon/Armor Modding UI
fModMenuEffectHighlightColorR: Highlight - Red Channel Color for the Weapon/Armor Modding UI
fModMenuEffectHighlightColorG: Highlight - Green Channel Color for the Weapon/Armor Modding UI
fModMenuEffectHighlightColorB: Highlight - Blue Channel Color for the Weapon/Armor Modding UI
fModMenuEffectHighlightPAColorR: Power Armor Highlight - Red Channel Color for the Weapon/Armor Modding UI
fModMenuEffectHighlightPAColorG: Power Armor Highlight - Green Channel Color for the Weapon/Armor Modding UI
fModMenuEffectHighlightPAColorB: Power Armor Highlight - Blue Channel Color for the Weapon/Armor Modding UI
bUseWaterDepth: Enable or Disable Water Depth. 1 = Enabled 0 = Disabled
bUseWaterReflections: Enables or disables Water Reflections. May help performance on weaker systems. 1 = Enabled 0 = Disabled
fOverShoulderMeleeCombatAddY: Moves the Y axis of the camera while in melee
fPitchZoomOutMaxDist: How far you can zoom out while in third person.
iDefaultWaitHours: Default Hours value when you press the Wait button.
bNvGodraysEnable: Turns on/off the God Rays (Nvidia Tech). Might be depreciated (at least in FO4VR)
bEnableRainOcclusion: Turns on/off the Rain Occlusion. Might be depreciated (at least in FO4VR)
iTexMipMapSkip: Changing may help with LOD texture pop-in...Might be depreciated (at least in FO4VR)
bEnableVatsWithScopes: Set to 1 to allow you to use scopes while also using VATS
bEnableRoomscaleMovement: Set to 1 to let your hitbox move along with your real movements around your playspace. Turn off to go back to a static hitbox
fRoomscaleMovementGradualRealignSpeed: Probably how fast your hitbox updates to your movements... Needs testing
fArrowSnapDistance: Lowering this prevents the autonocking of arrows at further distances. Set to 0 to turn off, recommend setting to 1
fArrowLerpDistance: Lowering this prevents the autonocking of arrows at further distances. Set to 0 to turn off, recommend setting to 1.5
fBowHoldOffsetY: Changings the grip position on the bow. Recommend changing to -6.6
fActivateRolloverWandScale: Change the size of activation text. Lower = Smaller
bAlwaysShowHands: Shows or hides your vr hands on weapons
bRenderSkinnedTrees: Disables "Skinned trees" when set to 0. Basically lowers tree quality. May increase performance
fTreeLoadDistance: How far trees render in. Setting this to 100000 has a low performance cost and a huge visual upgrade
bEnableAutoDynamicResolution: Set to 0 to turn of the automatica adjustment of in game super sampling (highly recommended)
fRenderTargetSizeMultiplier: In Game super sampling. 1.0 is no super sampling. This is a multiplier.
bShouldDisableDMInVATS: Disable Direct Movement while VATS is active. Disable=1 Enable DM=0
fVATSFireWeaponActionPointsMultiplier: VATS cost multiplier per weapon fire
fUHmdRotationLagMaxDistance: The farthest away UI elements will get before following the headset

iFPSClamp: This aligns the FPS of gameplay to that of your actual fps. It makes all game actions happen at a speed of your FPS divided by this value. If you get 60 fps and set this to 2, the game animations and everything will be 30 times as fast as normal, with accompanying bugs. If used, it is best to set it at a little under your current FPS. It is recommended to leave this at its default 0 so that the game speed always is the same speed as your FPS.

sCharGenQuest: This sets the quest id for the starting quest when you begin a new game.
sEssentialFileCacheList: This is probably is a caching system for essential game data (game data that is necessary for it to function properly). This should be a list of files with each entry separated by commas. An example value found: Data/Skyrim.esm, Data/Skyrim - Meshes.bsa, Data/Skyrim - Textures.bsa, Data/Skyrim - Animations.bsa, Data/Skyrim - Misc.bsa, Data/Skyrim - Shaders.bsa, Data/Skyrim - Interface.bsa, Data/Skyrim - Sounds.bsa
sLocalMasterPath: This is believed to be unused by the game.
sLocalSavePath: This sets the subdirectory where your game saves are stored at %USERPROFILE%/Documents/My Games/Skyrim. Changing this can be useful if you decide to organize your saves by character or other means. You could rename the save folder with all the John saves in it to John and change this value to access the John saves and so on. This value cannot be changed to a full path. Mod Organizer automatically overrides this setting when using profile-specific saves.
sStartingCell: This sets the starting cell for a new game, bypassing the main menu and the main quest startup.
sStartingCellX: This sets the x-coordinate in the starting cell specified in sStartingCell.
sStartingCellY: This sets the y-coordinate in the starting cell specified in sStartingCell.
sStartingWorld: This sets the worldspace of the starting cell specified in sStartingCell.
sTestFile1: This through This0 are settings that allow loading of plugins without using the standard loading method. Be advised that plugins loaded here will NOT automatically load their corresponding BSA files if they exist. These, however, can be added to the sArchiveList in [Archive].
sUnessentialFileCacheList: This probably is a caching system for unessential game data (game data that is the game can technically run without). This should be a list of files with each entry separated by commas. An example value found: Data/Skyrim - Voices.bsa, Data/Skyrim - VoicesExtra.bsa

fHitTexOffset: This is believed to be unused by the game.
bAllowLoadGrass: This toggles grass loading via the grass cache *.gid files. It is an alternative to creating grass (bAllowCreateGrass). It is typically disabled because the grass cache that comes with the vanilla game is not suitable for the current version, as it was never updated correctly by Bethesda. The SkyrimLE:Unofficial Skyrim Patch plugin INI contains this setting set to disabled.
bDrawShaderGrass: This toggles the grass shader. Enabling it enables grass, while disabling it will disable grass. It is recommended to be enabled.
bGenerateGrassDataFiles: This allows the game to create grass cache *.gid files if set to 1. These files can then in turn be loaded via bAllowLoadGrass.
bGrassPointLighting: This is believed to be unused by the game. In testing, no change was noticed.
fGrassDefaultStartFadeDistance: This is believed to be unused by the game. In testing, no change was noticed. It is possible that the value for this setting once changed the default value of fGrassStartFadeDistance, but it does not do that anymore, if it ever did.
fGrassFadeRange: This sets how far away grass will fade from the start fade distance (fGrassStartFadeDistance, which is Grass Fade in the in-game Settings > Display menu). It is recommended to adjust This rather than increase fGrassStartFadeDistance to reduce grass pop-in effect and performance benefits over the latter.
fGrassWindMagnitudeMax: This sets the maximum amount of wind blowing the grass, making the grass move. Setting fGrassWindMagnitudeMin and This to 0 will cause the grass to remain static and may give better performance.
fGrassWindMagnitudeMin: This sets the minimum amount of wind blowing the grass, making the grass move. Setting This and fGrassWindMagnitudeMax to 0 will cause the grass to remain static and may give better performance.
fTexturePctThreshold: This sets the texture percent threshold of the grass. Valid values range between 0 and 0.2, where 0 is full, and 0.2 altogether removes the grass. Negative values act as 0.
fWaveOffsetRange: This is believed to be unused by the game. In testing, no change was noticed.
iGrassCellRadius: This sets the radial number of cells that grass is rendered around the player. This must be set to (uGridsToLoad - 1)/2. If set higher, grass will bug out quickly and remove all grass upon walking just a short distance. If set lower, grass will pop into view unrealistically. Negative values disable grass.
iMaxGrassTypesPerTexure: This (sic) sets the maximum types of grass per texture. Increasing this will create more diverse kinds of grass, especially with grass mods such as Skyrim Flora Overhaul at a small performance cost. Without grass mods, changing this setting produces little effect. Negative values disable grass. t is recommended to increase this from its default 2 to 3. If using Skyrim Flora Overhaul, it is recommended to set this to 7.
bAddBipedWhenKeyframed: This toggles the ability of all characters to fly and possess all kinds of funky animations. It is recommended to be left disabled. It originated with Oblivion.

bWorldMapNoSkyDepthBlur: This toggles off the subtle sky depth blur applied to the map menu. It makes very little difference. It is recommended to be set to 1.
fMapMenuNearClipPlane: This sets the clipping pane for objects near each other. This effectively helps prevent z-fighting on the map menu. A value of 0 causes extreme z-fighting on the map menu. Unfortunately, it doesn't affect z-fighting elsewhere.
fMapMenuOverlayScale: This sets the scale of the terrain overlay on the map menu. It is recommended to be very small, but not 0, as 0 looks horrible. The default setting seems to be the best, but experiment with very small values around 0.00009.
fMapMenuOverlaySnowScale: This sets the scale of the snow overlay on the map menu. It is recommended to be very small, but not 0, as 0 looks horrible.
fMapWorldMaxPitch: This sets the maximum pitch that the user can change the angle of the map upwards. A value of 90 allows the user to angle the camera perpendicularly to the map while the right mouse button is pressed. A value of 180 will allow the user to look up at the sky overhead. It is recommended to set this to 90.
fMapWorldMinPitch: This sets the minimum pitch that the user can change the angle of the map downwards. A value of 0 allows the user to angle the camera straight down on the map while the right mouse button is pressed. It is recommended to set this to 0.
fMapWorldYawRange: This sets the yaw range that the map menu camera can turn when the right mouse button is pressed. Setting this to 400 allows the user to rotate full circle once. Increasing this beyond 400 allows the user to rotate more than full circle. Obsessively high values (e.g., 3600) induce crashes.
fWorldMapDepthBlurScale: This sets the scale of depth blurring applied to the map menu. It is recommended to be set to 0.
fWorldMapMaximumDepthBlur: This sets the maximum amount of depth blurring applied to the map menu. It is recommended to be set to 0.
fWorldMapNearDepthBlurScale: This sets the amount of depth blurring applied to the map menu at higher elevations. It is recommended to be set to 0.
uLockedObjectMapLOD: This sets the level of detail of objects on the map menu. Lowering this produces better details on objects, especially river falls, but will cause the map to load slightly slower. It has been observed to sometimes cause infinite loading screens when loading saves where it was a higher value. It is recommended to set this to 8.
uLockedTerrainLOD: This sets the level of detail of the terrain on the map menu. Lowering this produces better details on terrain, but will cause the map to load significantly slower (as in, wait thirty seconds for the map to load). It is therefore NOT recommended to lower this.
iConsoleHistoryCharBufferSize: This sets the number of characters that are displayed in the history list when using console commands like help. The default setting shows the last 16,384 characters in the history list.
bAllowFileWrite: This is believed to be unused by the game.
bDisableAssertQueuing: This is believed to be unused by the game.

bEnableLogging: This toggles Papyrus logs being written to disk. It is recommended to be disabled.
bEnableProfiling: This toggles script profiling, which enables profiling commands and allows profiling information to be logged, at the cost of some script performance. It is recommended to be disabled.
bEnableTrace: This toggles script tracing. Trace commands will not display in-game if this is disabled. It is recommended to be disabled.
bLoadDebugInformation: This toggles additional debug information. If enabled, line number information will be available in error traces at the expense of higher memory usage. It is recommended to be disabled.
uTraceStatusOfQuest: This sets a quest to track for script changes by form ID (converted to decimal). If Papyrus logging is enabled, every time a Papyrus script tries to change something with the quest that this setting specifies, like starting, stopping, setting a stage, or showing an objective, it will log the Papyrus stack trace. It was added with the official 1.6 patch.

bDisplayMissingContentDialogue: This toggles the dialogue box that appears when a save is attempted to be loaded when one or more plugins previously used on that save have been removed from the load order.
bOutputSaveGameScreenshot: This is believed to be unused by the game. This setting, although introduced in Skyrim, appears to do nothing. The title suggests that it would output a screenshot when a game is saved, but no screenshot was observed, and it does not change the built-in screenshot in the save.
bUsePagedBuffers: This was added in the official patch 1.4. Since the 1.4 changelog says it "Fixed rare crash with loading saved games," this addition most likely is the fix for said issue. Therefore, it is recommended to remain enabled.
bUseSaveGameHistory: This is a mystery setting. It is currently unknown what it might do.
iSaveGameBackupCount: This sets the number of backup save files with a .bak file extension to save. Each additional backup will have a extra .bak added to the end of it (e.g., if set to 2, there will be two backups for autosave1.ess: autosave1.ess.bak and autosave1.ess.bak.bak). Note that these backups are not identical, which leaves reason to believe that either each backup is generated independently of the original save, or there is some bug in the backup mechanism. Setting this to 0 will create no backups.
sSaveGameGameVersionOutdated: This was moved from the [MAIN] section to the [SaveGame] section. This message is displayed if a savegame from a newer version of the game that is attempted to be loaded on an older version of the game.
sSaveGameSafeMarkerID: This is a mystery setting. It is currently unknown what it might do.
fLODSnowThresholdAngle: This sets the snow level of detail threshold angle on distant terrain and the map menu (i.e., the amount of snow layered on distant mountains). It does not help z-fighting on distant mountains.

bEnableTreeAnimations: This toggles the "dynamic" rendering of trees. If disabled, all trees will be skinned and inanimate, using the "static" version of tree rendering. It seems to do the same thing as bEnableTrees. See the Skyrim Tree Settings Guide on STEP for more information.
bPickSkinnedTrees: This is believed to be unused by the game. In testing with multiple different combinations, no difference was noticed.
fUpdateBudget: This appears to control the amount of resources allocated to tree animations. If set to 0, tree animations will be effectively disabled while not causing all trees to be skinned. See the Skyrim Tree Settings Guide on STEP for more information.
bVATSAllowNoKill: This toggles the camera animation that zooms in on the target NPC when attacked but not killed. This enables the "kill cam" effect even when the target NPC is not hit or killed. Set this to 0 disable or 1 to enable the camera animation when attacking NPCs. This was added with the official 1.5 patch. Since the changelog states that it added "New cinematic kill cameras for projectile weapons and spells," this setting is presumed to be associated with that.
bVATSDisable: This toggles the camera animation that zooms in on the target NPC when killed. Set this to 0 to enable or 1 to disable the camera animation when the target NPC is killed.
bVATSForceRanged: This was added with the official 1.5 patch. Since the changelog states that it added "New cinematic kill cameras for projectile weapons and spells," this setting is presumed to be associated with that.
bVATSIgnoreProjectileTest: This was added with the official 1.5 patch. Since the changelog states that it added "New cinematic kill cameras for projectile weapons and spells," this setting is presumed to be associated with that.
bVATSMultipleCombatants: This toggles the camera animation that zooms in on the target NPC when attacked or killed and multiple combatants are present. Set this to 0 to disable or 1 to enable the camera animation when multiple combatants are present. This was added with the official 1.5 patch. Since the changelog states that it added "New cinematic kill cameras for projectile weapons and spells," this setting is presumed to be associated with that.
bVATSRangedSelective: This was added with the official 1.6 patch, which refined the logic of kill moves, resolving a number of issues.
bVATSSmartCameraCheckDebug: This is believed to be unused by the game.
fVATSCastingAfterKillDelay: This was added with the official 1.5 patch. Since the changelog states that it added "New cinematic kill cameras for projectile weapons and spells," this setting is presumed to be associated with that.
fVATSFocus: This is believed to be unused by the game.
fVATSRangedLowHealthPercent: This was added with the official 1.6 patch, which refined the logic of kill moves, resolving a number of issues.
fVATSRangedPercentMin: This sets the minimum percentage the camera zoom effect is shown in ranged attacks when not sneaking. The default value of 50 means the camera zoom effect is shown in 50% of attacks that kill the target NPC. This was added with the official 1.6 patch, which refined the logic of kill moves, resolving a number of issues.
fVATARangedPercentSneakKills: This sets the percentage the camera zoom effect is shown in ranged attacks when sneaking. The default value of 20 means the camera zoom effect is shown in 20% of attacks that kill the target NPC. fVATSRangedPercentSneakKill was added with the official 1.6 patch, which refined the logic of kill moves, resolving a number of issues.
fVATSRangePercentTargetNoThreat: This sets the percentage the camera zoom effect is shown in ranged attacks when the target NPC is not a threat. fVATSRangedPercentTargetNoThreat was added with the official 1.6 patch, which refined the logic of kill moves, resolving a number of issues.
fVATSRangedTargetLowLevelMult: This was added with the official 1.6 patch, which refined the logic of kill moves, resolving a number of issues.

fAudioVolumeMusic: Music volume. 0 = off, 1 = max. Set anywhere in between
fFilmGrainIntensity: This will set the amount of film grain. 0 = off, 1 = max. Set anywhere in between
bHasUserAccepted: This will either hide or show the EULA at the main menu. Set to 1 to accept
bEnableMotionBlur: This will enable or disable motion blur. 1 = on, 0 = off
fCASSharpnessValue: This Sets the sharpness leven of CAS. 0 = 0% 1 =  100%, anywhere in between is ok
fFPWorldFOV: This changes the first person Field of View
iBackgroundOpacity: Sets background opacity for the console
fQCZKeyDelay: Delay in seconds before the player grabs an interactive object.
bTemporalAA_idTech7: Used to disable TAA. 1 = On 0 = Off
bEnableMessageOfTheDay: Used to disable the MOTD section on the main menu. 0 = off 1 = On
bPilotCameraShakerEnabled: Disables camera shake when boosting your ship. 0 = off 1 = On
fDialogueCameraFailsafeFPFOV: Dialogue Camera First Person Field of View
fFarCameraDistanceOffset: Maximum distance the camera can be pulled back in 3rd person perspective
bEnableStarsOnPlanet: 1= Stars visible in skybox on planet, 0= Stars not visible in skybox on planet.
bBudgetEnabled: Whether or not outposts have a build budget. 1 for build limit, 0 for unlimited building (no budget).
fBudgetBaseCost: Multiplier for outpost building budget cost.
fBudgetBaseline: Outpost building budget, if enabled. See bBudgetEnabled.
fMaxAnisotropy: Anistropic filtering multiplier. Set it to 16 to greatly improve oblique texture quality with almost no performance impact.  In particular, it makes planet surfaces look MUCH more detailed
fResourceVeinOpenDuration: How long it takes for resource veins to close
fResourceVeinCloseDuration: How long it takes for resource veins to close
bStarMapEnableBodiesScanlines: Enable to display a scnaline effect over the starmap UI
bStarMapEnableLifeIcon: Display a life icon (a leaf) on Starmap near planets likely to harbor life.
bStarMapGravityWavesEnableNoise: Set if a noise is applied on Starmap gravity waves
fMouseHeadingSensitivityMin: Sets the minimum sensitivity value of the in-game mouse sensitivity slider.
fMouseHeadingSensitivityMax: Sets the maximum sensitivity value of the in-game mouse sensitivity slider.
bEnableDialogueLight: Enable or disable the light cast on npcs face when a dialogue is triggered
bDialogueLightRemoveNoMatch: Turns on/off the dialogue light camera. 1 = ON 0 = OFF
fShipBuilderModuleOverlapTolerance: Overlap Tolerance for Ship Parts in Build Mode
uLandingKeepBufferSize: This is the maximum number of your recent landing sites that will be remembered by the system. The actual amount is the value+1, so a value of 9 would cause the system to keep track of your last 10 landing spots.
bUsePressAndHoldControls: 0: Boostpack has a set amount of duration. 1: Boostpack starts\stops by holding\releasing space.
fZeroGBoostDrainInitial: Amount of fuel drained on first press
fZeroGBoostDrainSustained: Amount of fuel drained while holding space
fZeroGBoostMinFuelRequired: Minimum amount of fuel needed to activate boost
fStarMapGalaxyRotationMaxYaw: Distance your able to rotate the galxay starmap on the x axis. 45-180 works well
fStarMapGalaxyRotationMaxPitch: Distance your able to rotate the galxay starmap on the Y axis. 30-85 works well.
fStarMapGalaxyCameraYaw: The angle/degress the camera is positioned on the X(yaw) axis while looking at Galaxy StarMap. Can help offset the default to be able to see slightly better. 130-170 seems good.
fStarMapGalaxyCameraPitch: The angle/degress the camera is positioned on the Y(Pitch) axis while looking at Galaxy StarMap. Can help offset the default to be able to see slightly better. 0 Is what I have used but -20 - 20 should be good.
fStarMapGalaxyCameraDefaultFOV: Field of View for Galaxy StarMap View
